title: Curtis Pritchard says time apart from Maura Higgins helps relationship
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Curtis Pritchard and Maura Higgins are one of the last two remaining couples from this year’s Love Island (the only other being Tommy Fury and Molly Mae Hague) but he says time apart from each other helps keep their relationship fresh.

The ballroom dancer, 23, has found that his and Maura’s busy schedules has meant the couple have had to spend time apart since leaving the villa, but he says absence does make the heart grow fonder.

Curtis revealed to Metro.co.uk on the red carpet at the Pride Of Britain Awards how the pair have got through the first few months outside of the villa.

‘We’re just not letting anybody else influence it, really. Because obviously when we came out everyone was like “you’ve got to make it official”, this and that, why aren’t you posting things… and we’re just like “because it’s our relationship”.

‘We’re just going to chill out and take it easy, we’ve only known each other three and a half months and we’re just enjoying what’s what,’ he explained.

Curtis and Maura are one of the last remaining couples still together from this year’s Love Island (Picture: @maurahiggins)

Curtis added that not living in each other’s pockets has helped them outlast almost every other Love Island couple from this year: ‘I allow her to do all of the work that she needs to do, and she allows me to, so that gives us space as well.

‘And then when we come and see each other we actually really want to spend time together and we miss each other.’

Curtis has been busy filming a secret new reality show with Tommy Fury, while Maura is training for Dancing On Ice, but it looks like these two could go the distance, busy schedules and all.

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
